clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Effects Combined Suprascapular and Infraclavicular Nerve Blocks to Interscalene Nerve Block Applied Shoulder Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: It is compared that combined suprascapular and infraclavicular nerve blocks to interscalene nerve block for clinical outcomes after shoulder surgery

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators planned to investigate postoperative pain, analgesic dosage, respiratory effects of the block and side effects of patients undergoing general anaesthesia after shoulder surgery under preoperative interscalene nerve block or suprascapular + infraclavicular nerve block.

primary_outcome.description: postoperative pain will be evaluated by numeric rating scale (NRS) .

arm_group.description: preoperative interscalene nerve block to be applied with ultrasound guidance.
preoperative suprascapular and infraclavicular nerve block to be with ultrasound guidance

intervention.description: 30 minutes before anaesthesia induction interscalene nerve block will be applied with ultrasound guidance with %0,025 bupivacain 20 cc .
30 minutes before anaesthesia induction suprascapular with %0,025 bupivacain 10 cc .and infraclavicular nerve block with %0,025 bupivacain 10 cc will be applied with ultrasound guidance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for elective shoulder surgery under general anesthesia with suprascapular + infraclavicular nerve block or interscalene nerve block for any reason ASA 1-3 patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes
- coagulopathy
- local anesthetic allergy
- chronic opioid users
- advanced stage COPD

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital
